template.name: Fortigate 100D
template.description:
## Overview
Customized Template based on the original made by Leonardo Nascimento da Silva. Added LLD for Hostname, CPU, Memory and Serial Number.
Also added HA Status and basic SNMP info (Contact, Name, Uptime).
Tested with Fortigate 100D on Zabbix 3.4.6
BTW, I had to create some Value Mappings as follows:
Fortigate HA Auto Sync
1 > Disabled
2 > Enabled
Fortigate HA Status
1 > Standalone
2 > Active/Active
3 > Active/Passive
######################################
Template customizado baseado no original do Leonardo Nascimento da Silva. Adicionei LLD's para o Hostname, CPU, Memória e Número de Série das unidades (quando estiverem em HA).
Também adicionei o status do HA e informações básicas do SNMP (Nome, Uptime, Contato)
Testei com o Fortigate 100D no Zabbix 3.4.6
Inclusive, eu tive que criar alguns mapeamentos de valores:
Fortigate HA Auto Sync
1 > Desativado
2 > Ativado
Fortigate HA Status
1 > Sem HA
2 > Ativo/Ativo
3 > Ativo/Passivo
Cheers!
Luiz Fernando Gondin Santos
## Author
Luiz Fernando Gondin Santos

template.name: Template Module Linux block devices SNMP

item.name: CPU guest time
item.description: Guest time (time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system)

item.name: CPU guest nice time
item.description: Time spent running a niced guest (virtual CPU for guest operating systems under the control of the Linux kernel)

item.name: CPU idle time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU interrupt time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU iowait time
item.description: Amount of time the CPU has been waiting for I/O to complete.

item.name: CPU nice time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU softirq time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing software interrupts.

item.name: CPU steal time
item.description: The amount of CPU 'stolen' from this virtual machine by the hypervisor for other tasks (such as running another virtual machine).

item.name: CPU system time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU user time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

template.name: Template Module HOST-RESOURCES-MIB CUSTON SNMPv2
template.description: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB: CPU, Memory and Storage version: 0.14 MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB

template.template: Template Module Linux block devices SNMP
template.name: Template Module Linux block devices SNMP
template.description:
MIBs used: UCD-DISKIO-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.36

discovery_rule.name: Block devices discovery
discovery_rule.description: Block devices are discovered from UCD-DISKIO-MIB::diskIOTable (http://net-snmp.sourceforge.net/docs/mibs/ucdDiskIOMIB.html#diskIOTable)

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The number of read accesses from this device since boot.

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The 1 minute average load of disk (%)

item_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk write rate
item_prototype.description: MIB: UCD-DISKIO-MIB The number of write accesses from this device since boot.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Linux block devices SNMP:vfs.dev.read.rate[diskIOReads.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(1m)}>1000 or {Template Module Linux block devices SNMP:vfs.dev.write.rate[diskIOWrites.{#SNMPINDEX}].last(1m)}>1000
trigger_prototype.name: {#DEVNAME}: Disk read/write request responses are too high
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger might indicate disk {#DEVNAME} saturation.

item.host: Template Module Linux block devices SNMP
Template Module Linux block devices SNMP

macro.description: This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
This macro is used in block devices discovery. Can be overridden on the host or linked template level
